SENT.plain: In spite of the fact that an indirect relationship between NEIL1 gene and Type 2 diabetes has been demonstrated in animal model studies, there have been no human studies showing this relationship
In our study, we aimed to show the relationship between NEIL1 mutation and Type 2 diabetes in humans
The study group consisted 70 patients with Type 2 diabetes and the control group consisted of 50 healthy individuals
The mean age was 53±11 yr and 49±11 yr, respectively
Two NEIL1 mutations (2.9%) were detected in the patient group
There was A→G change (133A→G) at the 133. position of the 8th exon with 257 bp length in base sequencing
There was no mutation in the control group
We searched NEIL1 gene mutation for the first time in patients with Type 2 diabetes
This mutation was "silent" as it did not cause any amino acid change
The effects of these mutations on the etiopathogenesis of disease are not known
Although the lysine encoded by AAG was identical to the lysine encoded by AAA, it is not clear if they have functional differences due to the changing environmental conditions
NEIL1 gene mutation may have causative role in the development of Type 2 diabetes
